before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"3shc9","text":"Specimen Preparation:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"borvu","text":"Nucleic Acid can be extracted using the ThermoFisher MagMax™ Viral RNA Isolation Kit or the Qiagen QIAamp Viral RNA Mini Kit (Cat #52906). DMEM (ThermoFisher Cat. #: 11965-092) may be used to homogenize tissue prior to NA extraction. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"ckkd1","text":"This document describes a real-time 4-plex, TaqMan based RT-PCR assay used for the detection of the majority of SARS-CoV-2 strains, and differentiation of both Delta and Omicron variants. 18S ribosomal RNA gene is included as an internal control for the assay quality control. The Bio-Rad CFX 96, Bio-Rad CFX Opus 96 RT-PCR systems, or other real-time PCR systems that have similar function and can generate similar results, can be used for this assay.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7slqq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8r3a","text":"Method validation/evaluation/verification:\nThis method was evaluated through Single Randomized Method Test (SRMT) by Kansas State Veterinary Diagnostic Laboratory and Vet-LIRN. The SRMT report summarizing method performance evaluation data is available upon request.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":42}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
disclaimer: {"blocks":[{"key":"enp2v","text":"Reference to any commercial materials, equipment, or process does not in any way constitute approval, endorsement, or recommendation by the Food and Drug Administration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

groups.title: Multiplex real-time PCR assay for the detection of SARS-CoV-2 varients

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"d7kiu","text":"Always wear gloves.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1psof","text":"Put samples on ice until ready for use.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4i9gl","text":"Use aerosol pipette tips only.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"avo9t","text":"The master mix should be prepared ONLY in a clean hood designated for this purpose. Always prepare enough master mix to cover the number of samples and an additional 10-20%.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dl88a","text":"Master mix preparation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8o5lq","text":"Prepare the master mix in a 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tube using the volumes of reagents listed. DO NOT add the nucleic acid (template) at this time. Ice or cool blocks should be used for reaction preparation. Mix the master mix by low-speed vortexing, inverting, and/or flicking the tube, and then briefly centrifuge. Always prepare enough master mix for your samples, controls and an additional 10-20%.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bmup4","text":"Label PCR tubes, strips, worksheet or a plate map with sample IDs, negative controls, and positive controls. Add   of master mix to each well or tube. {"blocks":[{"key":"oe3","text":"Transfer plate or tubes with master mix to a DNA cabinet, or a clean working bench. Add   of sample (Template) to each corresponding PCR tube or well and mix by pipetting up and down several times. If the sample NA is in a plate, use extra caution when handling the uncovered NA plate to prevent any splashing. A multichannel pipet may be used to add 5μl of each sample NA to the reaction plate or tubes. Re-cover the NA plate immediately after all sample NA and control aliquots have been removed. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":88,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":88,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"0F45BB30B3A411EDAA006BB282441913","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3nbfa","text":"Data to be Recorded/Interpretation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":34}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2tiu8","text":"Positive Result: A positive sample is identified if Ct value is ≤37, and 18S Ct is ≤31.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"evuv","text":"Negative Result: A negative sample is defined if there is no Ct, or Ct \u003e39, and 18S Ct is ≤31","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6ovgg","text":"Other Possible Results (if applicable): A weak positive/suspect/inconclusive sample is defined if Ct is \u003e37 and ≤39, and 18S Ct is ≤31. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":40}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"btt6q","text":"Add   of the 100 µM probe stock solution and pipette up-and-down 2-3 times.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"6805DFD0B3A311EDAA006BB282441913","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}
